Detailed Description

The class Layouter is capable of layouting components and recursively other layouters inside a grid. The number of horizontal and vertical cells inside the grid can be specified in the constructor of Layouter. A componenent or another layouter can be arranged inside a cell.

Example: Two checkboxes and one editor are aligned vertically in a window. When the size of the window changes, the size of the controls is adjusted by the layouter. In the method Init of the window the three controls are initialized.

void MyWin::Init()
{
    Window::Init();
    m_checkbox_1.Init(this, Tr(L"CheckBox 1"), FALSE);
    m_checkbox_2.Init(this, Tr(L"CheckBox 2"), FALSE);
    m_editor.Init(this, InputMapper::Predictive, L"Test");
}

Variant 1: Each control gets 33 % of the window-height.

void MyWin::OnLayoutClient()
{
    Window::OnLayoutClient();
    Layouter layouter(1, 3, this);
    layouter.Arrange(0, 0, &m_checkbox_1);
    layouter.Arrange(0, 1, &m_checkbox_2);
    layouter.Arrange(0, 2, &m_editor);
}

Variant 2: Each checkbox gets 25 % and the editor 50 % of the window-height.

void MyWin::OnLayoutClient()
{
    Window::OnLayoutClient();
    Layouter layouter(1, 3, this);
    layouter.StretchYGrid(L"25,25,50", Layouter::Percent);
    layouter.Arrange(0, 0, &m_checkbox_1);
    layouter.Arrange(0, 1, &m_checkbox_2);
    layouter.Arrange(0, 2, &m_editor);
}

Variant 3: The checkboxes have a fixed size of 20 pixels and the editor gets the remaining size of the window.

void MyWin::OnLayoutClient()
{
    Window::OnLayoutClient();
    Layouter layouter(1, 3, this);
    layouter.StretchYGrid(L"20,20,--", Layouter::Pixel);
    layouter.Arrange(0, 0, &m_checkbox_1);
    layouter.Arrange(0, 1, &m_checkbox_2);
    layouter.Arrange(0, 2, &m_editor);
}

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Layouter::StretchUnit
 

Specifies, whether the stretching-parameters should be interpreted in percent or as pixels.

Enumerator:
Percent  Percent.
Pixel  Pixel.

enum Layouter::XAlign
 

Specifies the x-alignment of an element (= Component or another Layouter).

Enumerator:
XDefault  Use default-alignment (= Center).
Left  Align on the left side of the cell.
Center  Align centered inside the cell.
Right  Align on the right side of the cell.

enum Layouter::YAlign
 

Specifies the y-alignment of an element (= Component or another Layouter).

Enumerator:
YDefault  Use default-alignment (= Middle).
Top  Align on the top of the cell.
Middle  Align in the middle of the cell.
Bottom  Align on the bottom of the cell.

Member Function Documentation

void Layouter::Arrange (  INT  x_idx,
INT  y_idx,
Layouter *  layouter
) 
 

Arranges another layouter inside the cell indicated by the horizontal index x_idx and the vertical index y_idx.

Parameters:
x_idx Horizontal index of the cell, which should hold the Component (index starts at 0).
y_idx Vertical index of the cell, which should hold the Component (index starts at 0).
layouter Pointer to the layouter, which should be embedded.

void Layouter::Arrange (  INT  x_idx,
INT  y_idx,
Component *  content,
XAlign  x_align = XDefault,
YAlign  y_align = YDefault
) 
 

Arranges a Comonent inside the cell indicated by the horizontal index x_idx and the vertical index y_idx. By default the alignment given by the constructor will be used for all cells. To overwrite them for the cell, use x_align and y_align.

Parameters:
x_idx Horizontal index of the cell, which should hold the abstract drawable object (index starts at 0).
y_idx Vertical index of the cell, which should hold the Component (index starts at 0).
content Pointer to the Component, which should be embedded.
x_align Horizontal alignment of the Component (default: X_DEFAULT).
y_align Vertical alignment of the Component (default: Y_DEFAULT).

Size Layouter::GetCellSize (  INT  row,
INT  column
)  const
 

Returns:
the width and height of the cell at position x/y

void Layouter::StretchXGrid (  const WCHAR *  stretch_descr,
StretchUnit  unit = Percent
) 
 

By default each cell has the same width. This can be changed by specifying the string stretch_descr. Note: this method must be invoked before arranging the cells.

Parameters:
stretch_descr If the unit is Percent, it describes the percentual ratio of each cell. E. g. given are 3 x 3 cells. L"25,25,50" means the cells on the left need 25 % of the available width, the cells in the middle need 25 % and the cells on the right need 50 %.
If the unit is Pixel, it describes the width of each cell in pixels. The special string '--' can be used to stretch one cell to the remaining space. Note that only one cell may contain a '--'!
Parameters:
unit Describes, whether the stretch descriptor should be interpreted as percentual values or as pixel values.

void Layouter::StretchYGrid (  const WCHAR *  stretch_descr,
StretchUnit  unit = Percent
) 
 

By default each cell has the same height. This can be changed by specifying the string stretch_descr. Note: this method must be invoked before arranging the cells.

Parameters:
stretch_descr If the unit is Percent, it describes the percentual ratio of each cell. E. g. given are 3 x 3 cells. L"25,25,50" means the cells on the top need 25 % of the available width, the cells in the middle need 25 % and the cells on the bottom need 50 %.
If the unit is Pixel, it describes the height of each cell in pixels. The special string '--' can be used to stretch one cell to the remaining space. Note that only one cell may contain a '--'!
Parameters:
unit Describes, whether the stretch descriptor should be interpreted as percentual values or as pixel values.
